title: The $16 Cleanser Selena Gomez Used for Glowing Skin at the SAG Awards
description: When it comes to sourcing new beauty inspiration, we can always count on awards season to introduce us to a new product or show-stopping trend. This year, we're seeing the return of some old favorites - like Taylor Swift's trusted red lip and the controversial jellyfish haircut - alongside a slew of new celeb-approved beauty products, including some affordable surprises (we're talking under $20!). While celebrity glam is more typically associated with high-end, luxury beauty products, many celebrities opt to use more budget-friendly products for their red carpet looks. Selena Gomez opted for a $16 cleanser to prep her skin; Charli XCX tamed her voluminous curls with the help of a $9 styling creme; and even Miley Cyrus relied on an $11 lip tint to perfect her award-show pout. Ahead, we rounded up the best affordable beauty products under $40 that today's biggest stars relied on for the 2025 Awards season. From drugstore favorites to hair-care staples to plenty of editor-approved skin-care products, these beauty must haves will make it easy to achieve an A-list glam - even if you're on a budget. Keep reading to shop our favorite finds.
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Hollywood A-listers are embracing affordable beauty products like never before. Shop the best red carpet beauty products under $40.

When it comes to sourcing new beauty inspiration, we can always count on awards season to introduce us to a new product or show-stopping trend. This year, we're seeing the return of some old favorites — like Taylor Swift's trusted red lip and the controversial jellyfish haircut — alongside a slew of new celeb-approved beauty products, including some affordable surprises (we're talking under $20!).

While celebrity glam is more typically associated with high-end, luxury beauty products, many celebrities opt to use more budget-friendly products for their red carpet looks. Selena Gomez opted for a $16 cleanser to prep her skin; Charli XCX tamed her voluminous curls with the help of a $9 styling creme; and even Miley Cyrus relied on an $11 lip tint to perfect her award-show pout.

Ahead, we rounded up the best affordable beauty products under $40 that today's biggest stars relied on for the 2025 Awards season. From drugstore favorites to hair-care staples to plenty of editor-approved skin-care products, these beauty must haves will make it easy to achieve an A-list glam — even if you're on a budget. Keep reading to shop our favorite finds.

Red Carpet Skin-Care Products

Dr. Althea Green Relief Amino Gel Cleanser ($16)

Selena Gomez wowed on the red carpet of the 2025 SAG Awards, wearing an off-shoulder custom Celine gown paired with a bold red lip. But her flawless skin is what truly blew us away. Her longtime makeup artist, Hung Vanngo, prepped her skin with products from Dr. Althea's bestselling skincare line, including this cleanser which contains coconut-based and amino acid surfactants to gently clean sensitive skin.

Red Carpet Skin-Care Products

Vaseline Cocoa Shimmer Jelly Stick Cocoa Butter ($7)

You couldn't miss Keke Palmer's radiant glow on the SAG Awards red carpet, the perfect complement to her vintage Chanel 1985 gown and old Hollywood glam makeup look. According to makeup artist Kenya Alexis, you can credit Vaseline's Cocoa Shimmer Stick for some of that shine (the rest is natural, obviously!). Alexis applied the stick to the high points of Palmer's face for a warm, natural shimmer that can easily be recreated at home.

Red Carpet Skin-Care Products

Aquaphor Ointment Body Spray ($13)

Newly-minted Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter looked like the belle of the (music?) ball at the 2025 Grammys, where she slipped into a custom, baby blue JW Anderson dress. But it was her complementary glam that really got everyone talking. The star's makeup artist, Carolina Gonzalez, revealed all of the beauty essentials that went into creating Carpenter's "baby angel" look, including this hydrating Aquaphor spray.

Red Carpet Makeup Products

Urban Decay All Nighter Waterproof Makeup Setting Spray ($36)

At the 2025 Grammys, Doechii won big in more ways than one. Besides taking home the Grammy for best rap album, the breakout star also rocked one of the night's best beauty looks. The rapper's makeup artist, Dee Carrion, used several Urban Decay products to achieve her glam, including this setting spray, which helped to keep the star's makeup looking fresh — even during her Grammys performance.

Red Carpet Hair Products

Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil ($30)

Willow Smith leaned into her hair's natural texture at the 2025 Grammys, working with celebrity hairstylist Vernon Francois to style a chic, middle-part Afro. Francois revealed that Olaplex's cult-favorite bonding oil was key in prepping the musician's hair and scalp for the event.

For the full product details, read our review of the Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil.

Kyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer and editor with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She previously worked as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. Before joining PS, Kyley worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.

Jessica C. Andrews (she/her) is an award-winning editor and writer who works as the senior content director of PS Shopping. With more than 15 years of experience, her areas of expertise include fashion, shopping, and travel. Prior to joining PS, Jessica held senior roles at Teen Vogue, Refinery29, and Bustle and contributed to The New York Times, Elle, Vanity Fair, and Essence. She's appeared on "Good Morning America," NBC, and Fox 5 New York and spoken on various panels about fashion, hair, and Black culture.
